text: Upon heating in a stream of hydrogen gas, 0.688 g of a manganese oxide is reduced to metallic manganese and forms 0.235 g water. What is the formula of the oxide?
Which 1.00 g sample of an element contains the greatest number of molecules?

Hydrogen gas reacts with 5.00 L of nitrogen gas under constant temperature and pressure conditions to form 10.0 L of ammonia gas. What is the minimum volume of hydrogen gas required to produce this amount of ammonia?
After mixing 30.0 mL of 0.30 M Ca(NO3)2 solution and 15.0 mL of 0.60 M NaF solution, which ions are present in solution at concentrations of at least 0.10 M? I. Ca2+ II. F–
A salt whose formula is Na2SxOy is 47.5% sulfur by mass. What is the value of x in the formula?
Which salt is diamagnetic?
Which titration would NOT require the addition of an indicator?

options.A: Determination of oxalate ion by titration with permanganate ion in acidic solution
options.B: Determination of chloride ion by titration with silver ion
options.C: Determination of acetic acid by titration with sodium hydroxide
options.D: Determination of ammonia by titration with hydrochloric acid

text: A 1 mL sample of a 0.1 M solution of a divalent metal ion is pale pink. To it is added 1 mL of concentrated HCl, which causes a color change to bright blue. What is the metal ion?

A copper-nickel alloy is analyzed by dissolving it in 8 M nitric acid, diluting the solution with water, and then adding 1 mL of this diluted solution to an excess of aqueous potassium iodide. What are the principal forms of copper and nickel in this final mixture?

A dilute solution of sulfuric acid is titrated into a solution of barium hydroxide and the conductivity of the solution is measured as a function of the added volume of sulfuric acid. Which graph represents the results of this experiment?
Which is the best way to prepare 500 mL of a 2.00 M solution of aqueous H2SO4 from deionized water (M = 18.02, density = 1.00 g mL–1) and concentrated H2SO4 (M = 98.08, density = 1.84 g mL–1)?

options.A: Weigh 98.1 g concentrated sulfuric acid into a 500-mL beaker, then slowly add deionized water to the beaker, with occasional swirling, until the liquid reaches the 500 mL mark.
options.B: Weigh 98.1 g concentrated sulfuric acid into a 500-mL volumetric flask, slowly add deionized water to the mark, and mix.
options.C: Weigh 98.1 g concentrated sulfuric acid into a 100-mL beaker, then slowly pour the H2SO4 into a 500-mL beaker with about 250 mL deionized water in it. Pour this solution into a 500-mL volumetric flask and fill to the mark with deionized water and mix.
options.D: Weigh 446.6 g deionized water into a 500-mL volumetric flask, fill to the mark with concentrated sulfuric acid, and mix.

text: A substance has a density of 2.38 g mL–1 and is not significantly compressible. The substance is most likely in which physical state?

options.D: Solid or liquid; there is not enough information given to distinguish between the two

text: Carbon tetrachloride, CCl4, has a higher normal boiling point than chloroform, CHCl3 (77 ºC vs. 61 ºC). Differences in which interactions contribute the most to this difference in boiling point?
The diagram represents a molecular view of a sample of liquid methanol, CH3OH. Which letters in the diagram show hydrogen bonds?
The triple point of ammonia is 195.40 K at 0.006 bar, while its melting point is 195.42 K at 1 bar pressure. Which statement about ammonia is correct?

options.A: Solid ammonia is denser than liquid ammonia at 195.4 K.
options.B: Ammonia vapor cannot coexist with liquid ammonia at equilibrium at 195.5 K.
options.C: Ammonia vapor cannot coexist with solid ammonia at equilibrium at 195.3 K.
options.D: Solid ammonia and liquid ammonia cannot coexist at equilibrium at 195.5 K.

text: Acetone, C3H6O, has a vapor pressure of 0.307 bar at 25 ºC. A sample of 0.100 mol acetone is added to a container that contains 1.00 L of argon gas at 1.00 bar pressure and 25 ºC. The volume of the container is then increased to 4.00 L while maintaining the same temperature. What is the pressure in the container after the expansion?
What is the formula of the oxide whose unit cell is shown?

A spontaneous endothermic chemical reaction takes place at constant pressure and volume in a well-insulated container. As the reaction proceeds, what happens to the temperature of the system and to the internal energy of the reactants as they are transformed into products?

options.A: Both the temperature and the reactants’ internal energy increase.
options.B: The temperature increases while the reactants’ internal energy decreases.
options.C: The temperature decreases while the reactants’ internal energy increases.
options.D: Both the temperature and the reactants’ internal energy decrease.

text: What is the standard heat of formation (∆Hºf) of gaseous ethylene, C2H4(g)? H2(g) + ½ O2(g)  H2O(g) ∆Hº = –242 kJ mol–1 2 C(s, graphite) + 3 H2(g) + ½ O2 (g)  C2H5OH(l) ∆Hº = –278 kJ mol–1 C2H4(g) + H2O(g)  C2H5OH(l) ∆Hº = –88 kJ mol–1
The Ksp of AgBr is 5.0  10–13 at 25.0 ºC and 6.5  10–12 at 50.0 ºC. What is ∆Hºrxn for the precipitation of AgBr shown? Ag+(aq) + Br–(aq)  AgBr(s) ∆Hºrxn = ???
To a system consisting of 1.00 mol pure solid C6H6 at 5 ºC is added 20.0 kJ of heat while maintaining the pressure at 1 atm. In what phases is the benzene found?

The natural logarithm of the Ka of NH4+ is plotted below as a function of the reciprocal of the absolute temperature. Which statements are correct? I. The pH of a 0.100 M solution of NH4NO3 increases as the temperature is raised. II. ∆Sº for the acid dissociation of ammonium ion is positive.

options.D: Neither I nor II m after April 23, 2018

text: What can be concluded about the relative magnitudes of the heat of fusion of ice at 263 K (∆H263) compared to the heat of fusion of ice at 273 K (∆H273)?

options.D: No conclusion about the relative magnitudes of the heats of fusion can be drawn based on the information given.

text: What is the overall order of the reaction? 2 ICl(g) + H2(g) → 2 HCl(g) + I2(g)

The initial rate of the reaction A + B  products varies with the initial concentrations of A and B as follows: [A], M [B], M Initial rate, M s–1 0.20 0.30 2.1  10–4 0.40 0.30 4.2  10–4 0.20 0.90 1.9  10–3 What is the rate law for this reaction?

Polonium-210 undergoes alpha decay with a half-life of 138 d, forming the stable isotope lead-(206). How much time would it take for the activity of a 210Po sample to decrease to 15.0% of its initial value?

An irreversible reaction A + B  products is studied under conditions where the initial concentrations of A and B are equal. Under these circumstances, a graph of ln([A]) as a function of time is linear. What is the order in A?

options.D: The order in A cannot be determined based on the information given.

text: Nitric oxide reacts with hydrogen according to the following equation: 2 NO(g) + 2 H2(g)  N2(g) + 2 H2O(g) A possible mechanism for this reaction is 2 NO(g)  N2O2(g) fast, unfavorable N2O2(g) + H2(g)  N2O(g) + H2O(g) slow N2O(g) + H2(g)  N2(g) + H2O(g) fast What rate law is implied by this mechanism?
Which of the following solutions is capable of dissolving the most CaC2O4(s)?

Silver ion forms a complex ion with thiosulfate ion, Ag(S2O3)23–, with Kf = 2.8  
1013. How much AgBr (Ksp = 5.4  10–13) will dissolve in 1.00 L of 0.200 M Na2S2O3 solution?
100.0 mL 0.15 M aqueous HF (Ka = 6.8  10–4) is mixed with 125.0 mL 0.23 M NaF. What is the pH of the resulting solution?
For a given reaction, a graph of ln(Keq) vs. 1/T is linear and has a positive slope. Which statements about this reaction must be correct? I. ∆Hºrxn < 0 II. ∆Sºrxn > 0

The following reaction has Kp = 50.4 at 448 ºC. H2(g) + I2(g) 2 HI(g) If a 3.00 L flask initially contains 0.0500 moles each of H2 and I2, how many moles of HI are present when the contents have reached equilibrium at 448 °C?

Iodide ion is oxidized to hypoiodite ion by permanganate ion in basic solution according to the following unbalanced equation: I–(aq) + MnO4–(aq)  IO–(aq) + MnO2(s) What is the ratio of hydroxide ions to iodide ions in the balanced equation?
In the carbon monoxide complex Na[V(CO)6], what is the oxidation number of vanadium?
What is the Ksp of Fe(OH)2 at 298 K? Half-Reaction Eº, V (at 298 K) Fe2+(aq) + 2e–  Fe(s) –0.44 Fe(OH)2(s) + 2e–  Fe(s) + 2 OH–(aq) –0.89

A 0.100-g sample of an alloy of copper and silver is dissolved in nitric acid to give a solution containing Cu2+ and Ag+ ions. This mixture is electrolyzed exhaustively to redeposit all the metal ions as the elemental metals, requiring a current of 0.150 A for 1429 s. What is the mass percent of copper in the alloy?

Which electrochemical cell has the greatest (most positive) standard cell potential? Half-Reaction Eº, V Cd2+(aq) + 2e–  Cd(s) –0.40 Tl+(aq) + e–  Tl(s) –0.34 AgCl(s) + e–  Ag(s) + Cl–(aq) +0.22 Cu2+(aq) + 2e–  Cu(s) +0.34

The galvanic cell below has equal volumes in the two half- cells. As it is discharged at 25 ºC, the cell potential gradually decreases to zero, whereupon the discharge stops. What is the concentration of Cu2+(aq) when the discharge stops? Cu(s) | Cu2+(aq), 1.00 M || Fe(CN)63–(aq), 0.200 M | Fe(CN)64-(aq), 0.200 M | Pt Half-Reaction Eº, V Cu2+(aq) + 2e–  Cu(s) +0.337 Fe(CN)63–(aq) + e–  Fe(CN)64–(aq) +0.360
In which gas-phase atom are the 2s electrons closest on average to the nucleus?
Which electron configuration corresponds to a gas-phase oxygen atom in an excited state?
Alkali metals (Group 1) differ from alkaline earth metals (Group 2) of the same period in which way?

options.A: Alkali metals have larger ionic radii.
options.B: Alkali metals have higher melting points.
options.C: Alkali metals have greater first ionization energies.
options.D: Alkali metals have greater densities. m after April 23, 2018

text: Atoms of which element release the most energy when an electron is added to them in the gas phase?
How many unpaired electrons does a ground-state gas- phase Cr2+ ion have?
Which nuclide undergoes beta decay?
Which molecule has a nonzero dipole moment?
What is the geometry of XeF4?

Which statements are correct about the cyanate ion, NCO–? I. Cyanate is more thermodynamically stable than its isomer fulminate (CNO–). II. The carbon-nitrogen bond is shorter than the carbon-oxygen bond in gas-phase cyanate ion.
Which statement best describes the results of attempted separation by fractional distillation of the two isomers of 1,2-dichloroethene?

options.A: The two isomers can be separated by fractional distillation, with isomer 1 boiling at the lower temperature.
options.B: The two isomers can be separated by fractional distillation, with isomer 2 boiling at the lower temperature.
options.C: The two isomers cannot be separated by fractional distillation because both isomers have the same boiling point.
options.D: The two isomers cannot be separated by fractional distillation because they interconvert rapidly at the temperatures at which they distill. Page 8 Property of ACS USN

text: What is the coordination geometry of cobalt in the complex ion [Co(H2NCH2CH2NH2)2Br2]+?

Sulfur tetrafluoride adopts a see-saw geometry with two axial F atoms with a F–S–F angle of about 180º and two equatorial F atoms at about 90º from the axial fluorines. Which statement most accurately describes the axial and equatorial S–F bonds?

options.A: The axial S–F bonds are longer because the two fluorines must share bonding to the same orbital on sulfur.
options.B: The axial S–F bonds are longer because they experience greater repulsion from the other fluorine atoms in the molecule.
options.C: The equatorial S–F bonds are longer because the equatorial F–S–F bond angle is the smallest in the molecule.
options.D: The equatorial S–F bonds are longer because they experience greater repulsion from the lone pair on sulfur.

text: Which statement about the branched hydrocarbon shown is correct?

options.D: Radical chlorination gives 1-chloro-4-methylhexane as the major product.

text: How many distinct acyclic compounds have the formula C5H10?
When acetaldehyde (CH3CHO) reacts in methanol (CH3OH) solution under basic conditions, which compound is NOT formed?
In what way does the reactivity of CH3C≡CH differ from CH3CH=CH2?

options.A: Propyne is deprotonated by NaNH2, while propene is not.
options.B: Propyne does not react with bromine, while propene reacts readily with bromine.
options.C: Propyne undergoes catalytic hydrogenation over platinum, while propene does not.
options.D: Propyne is readily hydrated at pH = 0, while propene is not.

text: The amount of time I spend doing experiments in the laboratory per week on average during my chemistry course was/is?

options.D:
